title: Blended and Collaborative Learning Strategies for Strengthening Social Organization Management Competencies: Foundational Business Administration Skills Development

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic business terminology and fundamental mathematical literacy, foundational comprehension of social structures (organizations, institutions, culture), basic principles of civil society and experience in community activities
context.additional_context: Real-time feedback and group activity monitoring system using digital tools. Emphasizes case analysis considering economic/political/cultural contexts. Focuses on citizen-participatory project design for solving local community issues

learning_goals: Learners can apply core management concepts (e.g., organizational management, marketing strategies) to real-world social cases (e.g., local business-government collaboration projects) and explain them within economic and political contexts.

Learners will set and achieve at least three self-directed learning goals per month (including civic engagement tasks) over six months using a public educational institution’s LMS (e.g., Google Classroom) and tablets, document their progress through weekly learning journals (with ≥80% completion rate), and submit a final project report (meeting ≥4 out of 5 rubric criteria) linking digital learning outcomes to community issues (e.g., support strategies for digitally marginalized groups).

Learners will work in 4–5 member teams over four weeks to create a role-division plan (with civics-based role definitions), produce ≥3 weekly meeting minutes, and complete a collaborative project (focused on solving community issues) that meets ≥4 out of 5 peer-evaluation checklist items, culminating in a presentation.

Learners will propose ≥3 creative solutions to problems presented in group discussions (e.g., regional economic disparities) and explore practical systemic improvements (e.g., introducing local currency).

resources: Smart Pads and Basic Analysis Software
Circular table arrangement for collaborative learning
Emotion analysis AI program (for measuring group participation)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
